Text: @Starbucks @StarbucksIndia @DLFMoI
Name: Gauri

Text:
2) As a wheelchair user, Am I suddenly
expected to walk inside somehow to
place my order or should not bother to
do it altogether?

3) why is my friend supposed to speak or order for me? What was I supposed to do if I went alone?
Name: Gauri

Text:
honestly, what makes me even more
angry is that the said person didn't even
bother to come and talk to me directly.
My friend had to go inside to request
them and right from there, the answer
was "No'.
1. There was no ramp. Despite @Starbucks being a world wide chain.
(Contd.)
Name: Gauri

Text:
Went to @StarbucksIndia at DLF, Mall of India, Noida with a friend There was
a step so my wheelchair couldn't go in. We requested
them to take our order outside (seating was there). The
answer? "No." "You have to
come inside to order" despite
seeing I'm a wheelchair user (contd) https://t.co/sy44KRJoqy
Name: Gauri

Text: On #WorldHealthDay this your reminder that one can be disabled and healthy. Health is a spectrum. It is not a one shoe fits all checklist.
Name: Gauri

Text: RT @AnnaSeverwright : Just heard on the radio 'I don't think we'll ever see the Queen in a wheelchair' she wouldn't give in. Can we all (including the media) stop this idea that using a wheelchair is giving in or so awful that we couldn't possibly see a 95 year old use one if she needed.
Name: Gauri

Text: RT @dominickevans : Disabled people like me are often forgotten. It's an absolute truth. And part of it is because society doesn't recognize people like me as contributing members of society, and therefore we are dehumanized.
Name: Gauri

Text:
Once this guy told me, he'd "put up" with my disability 
I decided not to put up with him the next second ü§°
Best decision ever
Name: Gauri

Text:
RT @GHMansfield : Ableism isn‚Äôt a theory.
It preys upon disabled people.
Name: Gauri

Text:
RT @laura_shantz : @StopgapOttawa I still hear a lot of ableist language that ignores the lived realities of disabled folks. The other day someone I know referred to a wheelchair user as being "confined to a wheelchair." ü§¶

Said wheelchair user was shopping at the grocery store -not my definition of "confined"!
Name: Gauri

Text: RT @Imani_Barbarin : Disabled people, if no ones told you lately, I am proud of y‚Äôall for just making it through each day as you are.
Name: Gauri

Text: RT @alady49641858 : @thecripgang @whogaurigupta @thecripgang thank you for putting the narratives of disabled folx first!!!
Name: Gauri

Text: RT @thecripgang : In addition, she adds - ''Another challenge is the lack of autonomy. The autonomy to choose for people with disabilities often lies at the mercy of their caregivers due to the pre-existing stigma.'' @whogaurigupta (9)
Name: Gauri

Text: RT @thecripgang : @whogaurigupta - ''Access is a major barrier when it comes to SHRH for persons  with disabilities. Being a part of a marginalized community, disabled folx are excluded from the narrative. Absence of any specific laws and legislations for pwds in the given context.'' (8)
Name: Gauri

Text: RT @thecripgang : Why do we only acknowledge movement? Why do we need to move all the time? Why does movement equate freedom? Why can't we honour our non-movement, our moments of absolute stillness, moments which give comfort to our weary disabled bodies in a non-disabled world? #Unlearning
Name: Gauri

Text:
RT @GHMansfield : Disabled people don‚Äôt need to be called ‚Äúhandicapable.‚Äù
Disabled people know we are capable.

Disabled people don‚Äôt need to be called ‚Äúdifferently abled.‚Äù
Disabled people know we have abilities.

Euphemisms are for those who doubt and devalue us.

Text:
Most educational institutions where we learn about equality, marginalization, discrimination, etc conveniently exclude disabled folks because apparently we're not 'normal' enough.

Thoughts?
Name: Gauri

Text: RT @SheepMarching : Join us today live at 5 PM as we speak with @whogaurigupta , a student, writer, artist, and a disability inclusion activist. She lives with Spina Bifida- myelomeningocele, which has led to locomotor disability. She is also a para-athlete at state and national levels. https://t.co/lFOsFSszyG
Name: Gauri

Text:

That‚Äôs it.

No demands, nothing unreasonable, just a request to tell us blind folks what is in your pictures so we can enjoy them too.
